cta.title: Ready to Explore Madagascar?
cta.description: Let our local experts create the perfect itinerary combining multiple destinations for your ultimate Madagascar adventure.

andasibe-mantadia.name: Andasibe-Mantadia
andasibe-mantadia.subtitle: Home of the Indri Indri
andasibe-mantadia.description: Experience the haunting calls of Madagascar's largest lemur in this pristine rainforest reserve, just 3 hours from Antananarivo.

nosy-be-archipelago.name: Nosy Be Archipelago
nosy-be-archipelago.subtitle: Crystal clear waters & reefs
nosy-be-archipelago.description: The scented island paradise with pristine beaches, coral reefs, and the famous ylang-ylang plantations.

avenue-baobabs.name: Avenue of the Baobabs
avenue-baobabs.subtitle: Iconic sunset landscapes
avenue-baobabs.description: Madagascar's most photographed location featuring ancient baobab trees creating magical silhouettes at sunset.
highlights: Ancient baobab trees over 800 years old

tsingy-bemaraha.name: Tsingy de Bemaraha
tsingy-bemaraha.subtitle: Stone forest adventure
tsingy-bemaraha.description: Navigate through razor-sharp limestone pinnacles in this UNESCO World Heritage site, home to unique endemic species.

isalo-national-park.name: Isalo National Park
isalo-national-park.subtitle: Madagascar's Grand Canyon
isalo-national-park.description: Dramatic sandstone formations, hidden oases, and natural swimming pools in Madagascar's most spectacular landscape.

anakao-beach.name: Anakao Beach
anakao-beach.subtitle: Pristine southern coast
anakao-beach.description: Untouched white sand beaches with crystal clear waters, perfect for snorkeling and experiencing Vezo fishing culture.

ranomafana-national-park.name: Ranomafana National Park
ranomafana-national-park.subtitle: Hot springs & golden bamboo lemurs
ranomafana-national-park.description: Lush rainforest sanctuary famous for its natural hot springs and the rare golden bamboo lemur discovery.

antananarivo-highlands.name: Antananarivo & Central Highlands
antananarivo-highlands.subtitle: Culture & terraced rice fields
antananarivo-highlands.description: Explore Madagascar's cultural heart with royal palaces, traditional markets, and stunning highland landscapes.

sainte-marie-island.name: Sainte-Marie Island
sainte-marie-island.subtitle: Pirate history & whale watching
sainte-marie-island.description: Tropical island paradise with pirate history, pristine beaches, and spectacular humpback whale watching from July to September.

pangalanes-canal.name: Pangalanes Canal
pangalanes-canal.subtitle: Waterway journey through villages
pangalanes-canal.description: A network of natural and man-made waterways connecting lakes, rivers, and coastal lagoons along Madagascar's east coast.

antsirabe.name: Antsirabe
antsirabe.subtitle: Thermal city & rickshaw capital
antsirabe.description: Madagascar's thermal city known for its volcanic crater lakes, "Pousse-Pousse" rickshaws, and gemstone markets.
highlights: Horseback riding at Ranch du Bonheur

morondava-coast.name: Morondava Coast
morondava-coast.subtitle: Gateway to baobabs & tsingy
morondava-coast.description: Coastal town serving as the gateway to the Avenue of Baobabs and Tsingy de Bemaraha, with beautiful beaches and Vezo culture.

tamatave-toamasina.name: Tamatave (Toamasina)
tamatave-toamasina.subtitle: Major port & spice markets
tamatave-toamasina.description: Madagascar's main seaport with vibrant markets, colonial architecture, and access to the Pangalanes Canal.
highlights: Bazar Be market for spices and vanilla

manambato-lake.name: Manambato & Lake Rasoabe
manambato-lake.subtitle: Lakeside tranquility
manambato-lake.description: Peaceful lakeside village on the shores of Lake Rasoabe, serving as a departure point for Pangalanes Canal journeys.

ankarinny-nofy.name: Ankanin'ny Nofy
ankarinny-nofy.subtitle: The "Nest of Dreams"
ankarinny-nofy.description: Peninsula in the Pangalanes Canal known as the "Nest of Dreams," home to the Palmarium Private Park and rare wildlife.
highlights: Palmarium Private Park with close lemur encounters
Carnivorous Pitcher plants and rare orchids

miandrivazo.name: Miandrivazo
miandrivazo.subtitle: Gateway to Tsiribihina River
miandrivazo.description: Hot, lively town on the banks of the Tsiribihina River, known as a starting point for river expeditions.
highlights: Local cuisine at Princesse de la Tsiribihina

bekopaka-tsingy.name: Bekopaka (Tsingy Base)
bekopaka-tsingy.subtitle: Base for Tsingy exploration
bekopaka-tsingy.description: Small village serving as the base camp for exploring both the Grand and Petit Tsingy de Bemaraha.
highlights: Access to Grand and Petit Tsingy

ambatolampy.name: Ambatolampy
ambatolampy.subtitle: Aluminum craftsmanship
ambatolampy.description: Town famous for its traditional aluminum pot craftsmanship, where artisans forge pots by hand using recycled materials.

ambositra.name: Ambositra
ambositra.subtitle: Woodcraft capital
ambositra.description: Heart of Madagascar's woodcraft industry, home to the Zafimaniry people and their UNESCO-recognized woodcarving traditions.

tulear-toliara.name: Tuléar (Toliara)
tulear-toliara.subtitle: Southern coastal city
tulear-toliara.description: Vibrant coastal city in southern Madagascar, gateway to Anakao beach and the spiny desert region.
highlights: Gateway to Anakao and southern beaches

anja-reserve.name: Anja Community Reserve
anja-reserve.subtitle: Ring-tailed lemur haven
anja-reserve.description: Community-run reserve where ring-tailed lemurs are easily spotted among impressive granite rock formations.

nosy-iranja.name: Nosy Iranja
nosy-iranja.subtitle: Turtle Island & sandbank
nosy-iranja.description: Two small islands connected by a spectacular white sandbank that appears at low tide, known as "Turtle Island".

nosy-tanikely.name: Nosy Tanikely
nosy-tanikely.subtitle: Marine reserve snorkeling
nosy-tanikely.description: Protected marine reserve with exceptional snorkeling opportunities among coral reefs, sea turtles, and tropical fish.

nosy-komba.name: Nosy Komba
nosy-komba.subtitle: Island of Lemurs
nosy-komba.description: Volcanic island known for its black lemurs, traditional woodcarving villages, and relaxed atmosphere.

nosy-sakatia.name: Nosy Sakatia
nosy-sakatia.subtitle: Orchid Island
nosy-sakatia.description: Peaceful island known as the "Orchid Island" for its rich flora, with opportunities to snorkel with giant green sea turtles.
highlights: Snorkeling with giant green sea turtles

mont-passot.name: Mont Passot
mont-passot.subtitle: Sunset over crater lakes
mont-passot.description: Highest point on Nosy Be offering 360-degree panoramic views of the island's volcanic crater lakes and the Mozambique Channel.

hell-ville.name: Hell-Ville (Andoany)
hell-ville.subtitle: Nosy Be main town
hell-ville.description: Main town of Nosy Be, known for its vibrant market selling spices, vanilla, and ylang-ylang essential oils.

eastMadagascar.title: East Madagascar Tour
eastMadagascar.subtitle: Rainforest & Wildlife Discovery
eastMadagascar.description: Please note that the itinerary can be fully customized according to your needs. A legendary 11-day journey through the verdant rainforests of Andasibe, discovering rare orchid species and spotting the iconic Indri lemurs in their natural habitat.
eastMadagascar.label: Best Seller

day1.title: Arrival in Antananarivo (Tana)
day1.description: Land at Ivato International Airport, Tana. We will greet you at Ivato Airport and transfer you to your hotel. Meet your guide and transfer to hotel. Optional city tour: Independence Avenue, Rova Palace, lemur's park, the Queen's staircase and d'Andohalo Cathedrale. Dinner at a local restaurant.

day2.title: Antananarivo – Andasibe
day2.description: Depart from the capital city, Antananarivo, heading east along the winding National Road 2. Stop at the Peyrieras Reptile Reserve in Marozevo to observe dozens of species of chameleons, leaf-tailed geckos, and butterflies. Upon reaching Andasibe, you will head out for a guided night walk to catch the reflective eyes of tiny mouse lemurs, sleeping chameleons, and endemic frogs.

day3.title: Andasibe (Analamazaotra) – Manambato
day3.description: Morning: Hike in the Analamazaotra National Park to find the Indri-Indri, the largest living lemur, known for its haunting, whale-like song. Afternoon: Drive further east to Manambato, located on the shores of Lake Rasoabe.

day4.title: Crossing to Ankanin'ny Nofy
day4.description: Morning: Board a boat for a scenic transfer on the Pangalanes Canal to the Ankanin'ny Nofy peninsula (the "Nest of Dreams"). Afternoon: Relax by the white sand lake beaches or walk through local fishing villages. Evening: Night boat excursion to see the Aye-Aye, Madagascar's rarest and most bizarre nocturnal primate.

day5.title: Palmarium Reserve Exploration
day5.description: Morning: Visit the Palmarium Private Park. This is one of the few places where you can get very close to various lemur species (Macacos, Coronatus, Indri). Afternoon: Discover the local flora, including carnivorous Pitcher plants and rare orchids.

day6.title: Ankanin'ny Nofy – Tamatave (Toamasina)
day6.description: Morning: A long, peaceful boat ride north along the Pangalanes Canal. Observe life along the riverbanks: bamboo rafts, local commuters, and washing stations. Afternoon: Arrival at the river port of Tamatave. Take a Pousse-Pousse (rickshaw) tour of the city and visit the "Bazar Be" market for spices and vanilla.

day7.title: Tamatave – Mahambo – Sainte-Marie
day7.description: Morning: Drive north along the coast to the village of Mahambo. Midday: Board the ferry (e.g., El Condor) for a 2.5-hour crossing to the island of Sainte-Marie (Nosy Boraha). Evening: Arrival on the island and transfer to your beachfront bungalow.

day8.title: Sainte-Marie (Island Paradise) - Day 1
day8.description: Activities to choose from: Île aux Nattes (take a traditional pirogue to this tiny, car-free island), Pirate Cemetery (visit the world's only official pirate cemetery), Whale Watching (if traveling between July and September), Exploration (rent a scooter or bicycle to explore the lush interior and hidden coves).

day9.title: Sainte-Marie (Island Paradise) - Day 2
day9.description: Continue exploring Sainte-Marie with more activities: snorkeling, beach relaxation, cultural visits, or adventure excursions around the island.

day10.title: Sainte-Marie – Antananarivo (Flight)
day10.description: Morning: Enjoy a final tropical breakfast or a swim in the lagoon. Afternoon: Transfer to the airport for your domestic flight (Tsaradia) back to Antananarivo. Evening: Farewell dinner at a restaurant in the upper city of Tana.

day11.title: Antananarivo – Departure
day11.description: Morning: Visit the Queen's Palace (Rova) for a lesson in Malagasy history and a 360-degree view of the city. Afternoon: Last-minute souvenir shopping at the Digue Market (artisanal crafts) before your transfer to Ivato International Airport.

southMadagascar.title: South Madagascar Tour
southMadagascar.subtitle: The RN7 Route
southMadagascar.description: Please note that the itinerary can be fully customized according to your needs. A legendary 9-day journey from the bustling capital to the white sands of the Mozambique Channel, crossing the soul of the Red Island.

day1.title: Arrival in Antananarivo (Tana)
day1.description: Land at Ivato International Airport, Tana. We will greet you at Ivato Airport and transfer you to your hotel. Meet your guide and transfer to hotel. Optional city tour: Independence Avenue, Rova Palace, lemur's park, the Queen's staircase and d'Andohalo Cathedrale. Dinner at a local restaurant.

day2.title: Tana to Antsirabe
day2.description: Leave the capital early in the morning and head south. Stop at Ambatolampy to see local artisans forge aluminum pots by hand. Continue to Antsirabe, a city known for its "Pousse-Pousse" (rickshaws) and gemstones. We can accompany you to the Ranch du Bonheur in Antsirabe for a horseback ride if you are interested. Visit local crafts markets (miniatures, gemstones). Optional pousse-pousse (rickshaw) tour in the city.

day3.title: Antsirabe to Ranomafana
day3.description: Leave Antsirabe in the morning and go to Ranomafana. Transition from the red-clay houses of the highlands to the dense tropical rainforest of Ranomafana. Stop in Ambositra for Zafimaniry woodcraft visit. Evening relaxation at lodge.

day4.title: Ranomafana Exploration
day4.description: Guided hike in Ranomafana National Park. Spot endemic wildlife: golden bamboo lemurs, sifakas, and exotic birds. Visit natural hot springs after hiking.

day5.title: Ranomafana to Isalo
day5.description: Leave Ranomafana and go to Isalo. Anja Reserve: A community-run park where Ring-tailed lemurs (King Julien!) are extremely easy to spot. Scenic drive through the highlands and small villages. Evening: Sunset over Isalo's sandstone formations.

day6.title: Isalo to Tuléar
day6.description: Morning visit at Isalo National Park which is a majestic landscape of eroded Jurassic sandstone, deep canyons, and hidden oases. Morning hike in Isalo (optional: Canyon des Singes & Natural Pools). Then Drive to Tuléar.

day7.title: Tuléar – Anakao
day7.description: Breakfast in hotel; transfer to the port and boarding on a moto-boat and navigation to Anakao for about 1h30; at the arrival set up in hotel (standard room) or similar; rest of the day at your disposal for swimming in the reef clear water and individual visits; full-board in hotel.

day8.title: Anakao Exploration
day8.description: Snorkeling or diving in coral reefs. Visit local Vezo fishing village. Optional boat trip to Nosy Ve for birdwatching. Sunset on the beach.

day9.title: Anakao to Tuléar then back to Tana
day9.description: Morning boat back to Tuléar. Fly from Tuléar to Antananarivo (~1.5 hours). Optional last-minute souvenir shopping. Transfer to Ivato Airport for departure.

westMadagascar.title: West Madagascar Tour
westMadagascar.subtitle: Baobab & Tsingy Adventure
westMadagascar.description: Please note that the itinerary can be fully customized according to your needs. A photographer's dream. Witness the Avenue of Baobabs at sunset and hike the surreal limestone labyrinths of Tsingy de Bemaraha.
westMadagascar.label: Adventure

day1.title: Arrival in Antananarivo (Tana)
day1.description: Land at Ivato International Airport, Tana. We will greet you at Ivato Airport and transfer you to your hotel. Meet your guide and transfer to hotel. Optional city tour: Independence Avenue, Rova Palace, lemur's park, the Queen's staircase and d'Andohalo Cathedrale. Dinner at a local restaurant.

day2.title: Tana - Antsirabe
day2.description: Leave the capital early in the morning and head south. Stop at Ambatolampy to see local artisans forge aluminum pots by hand. Continue to Antsirabe, a city known for its "Pousse-Pousse" (rickshaws) and gemstones. We can accompany you to the Ranch du Bonheur in Antsirabe for a horseback ride if you are interested. Visit local crafts markets (miniatures, gemstones). Optional pousse-pousse (rickshaw) tour in the city.

day3.title: Antsirabe - Morondava
day3.description: After breakfast, drive to Morondava. A long but scenic transition from the green highlands to the dry western plains. Stop 1: Miandrivazo: A hot, lively town perfect for a lunch break at Princesse de la Tsiribihina. Evening: Arrival in Morondava. Enjoy the sea breeze.

day4.title: Morondava - Bekopaka
day4.description: Take breakfast and then go to the Tsingy. Stop 1: Belo-sur-Tsiribihina: After crossing the river by ferry, stop for lunch at the famous Mad Zebu—unexpected high-end cuisine in a remote village. Stop 2: Manambolo River Crossing: The second ferry crossing as you approach the village of Bekopaka.

day5.title: The Big Tsingy
day5.description: Main Activity: 1-hour drive to the Grand Tsingy. You will wear a climbing harness to navigate limestone needles, narrow canyons, and the famous suspension bridge over the razor-sharp rocks. Wildlife: Look for the Decken's Sifaka (white lemur) and the Giant Coua bird.
day5.accommodation: Same hotel at Tsingy de Bemaraha

day6.title: Petit Tsingy & Manambolo Gorge
day6.description: Morning: A traditional pirogue (dugout canoe) trip on the Manambolo River to see ancient Vazimba tombs and river caves. Afternoon: Explore the Petit Tsingy, which offers a different perspective on the rock formations with less intense climbing.
day6.accommodation: Same hotel at Tsingy de Bemaraha

day7.title: Bekopaka - Morondava
day7.description: Stop 1: Baobab Amoureux: Two ancient baobabs twisted together in a permanent "hug." Stop 2: Kirindy Forest (Optional): If you leave Bekopaka very early, you can squeeze in a quick walk here to look for the Fossa (Madagascar's top predator).

day8.title: Morondava – Tana
day8.description: Morning: Visit the Betania Fishing Village by pirogue to see the traditional Vezo way of life. Then, leave Morondava and go to the airport of Morondava to take the domestic flight back to Tana.

day9.title: Morondava - Tana
day9.description: After breakfast, go to the airport to take your international flight back.

northMadagascar.title: North Madagascar Tour
northMadagascar.subtitle: Rainforest & Island Paradise
northMadagascar.description: Please note that the itinerary can be fully customized according to your needs. Discover the call of the Indri in Andasibe rainforest, then escape to the tropical paradise of Nosy Be with its pristine beaches and marine reserves.
northMadagascar.label: Popular

day1.title: Arrival in Antananarivo
day1.description: Meet at the airport and transfer to your hotel. Relax or take a short walk in the capital to adjust to the local rhythm.

day2.title: Tana to Andasibe-Mantadia (The Rainforest)
day2.description: Morning: Drive East (approx. 4 hours) through highland scenery and local villages. Afternoon: Visit the Vakona Private Reserve (Lemur Island) where you can interact closely with several lemur species. Evening: Enjoy a night walk along the park boundaries to spot nocturnal lemurs (mouse lemurs) and sleeping chameleons.

day3.title: The Call of the Indri & Return to Tana
day3.description: Morning: Guided hike in Analamazaotra National Park to find the Indri-Indri, the largest lemur in the world, known for its haunting whale-like song. Afternoon: Drive back to Antananarivo (approx. 4 hours).

day4.title: Flight to Nosy Be
day4.description: Morning: Domestic flight from Tana to Nosy Be. Afternoon: Transfer to your hotel. Visit the local market in Hell-Ville for spices and ylang-ylang oil.

day5.title: Nosy Komba & Nosy Tanikely
day5.description: Nosy Komba: Visit the "Island of Lemurs" to see the black lemurs and local woodcarvings. Nosy Tanikely: Head to this marine reserve for world-class snorkeling. The water is crystal clear with turtles and coral reefs.

day6.title: The Paradise of Nosy Iranja
day6.description: Day Trip: A scenic boat ride to the "Turtle Island." Highlight: Walk the famous white sandbank connecting the two islets. It is the most photographed spot in Madagascar.

day7.title: Nosy Sakatia (The Orchid Island)
day7.description: Activity: A peaceful day on Sakatia. Explore the botanical trails and snorkel with giant green sea turtles in their natural feeding grounds.

day8.title: Mont Passot & Crater Lakes
day8.description: Morning: Leisure time on the beach. Late Afternoon: Drive to Mont Passot, the island's highest point. The View: Enjoy a 360-degree sunset over the volcanic lakes and the Mozambique Channel.

day9.title: Return to the Capital
day9.description: Morning: Last swim or souvenir shopping. Afternoon: Flight back to Antananarivo. Evening: Farewell dinner at a local restaurant like Le Carré or La Varangue.

day10.title: Final Departure
day10.description: Activity: Transfer to Ivato International Airport for your flight home.
